trans-unit.source: Reads a value from the registry.

seg-source.mrk: Reads a value from the registry.

target.mrk: Reads a value from the registry.

trans-unit.source: the requested registry value. @extended is set to the type of the value $REG_... . These types are defined in the "Constants.au3" include file.

seg-source.mrk: @extended is set to the type of the value $REG_... .
These types are defined in the "Constants.au3" include file.

target.mrk: @extended is set to the type of the value $REG_... .
These types are defined in the "Constants.au3" include file.

trans-unit.source: 2 = unable to open requested main key

seg-source.mrk: 2 = unable to open requested main key

target.mrk: 2 = unable to open requested main key

trans-unit.source: 3 = unable to remote connect to the registry

seg-source.mrk: 3 = unable to remote connect to the registry

target.mrk: 3 = unable to remote connect to the registry

trans-unit.source: A registry key must start with "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" ("HKLM") or "HKEY_USERS" ("HKU") or "HKEY_CURRENT_USER" ("HKCU") or "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT" ("HKCR") or "HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG" ("HKCC").

seg-source.mrk: A registry key must start with "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" ("HKLM") or "HKEY_USERS" ("HKU") or "HKEY_CURRENT_USER" ("HKCU") or "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT" ("HKCR") or "HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG" ("HKCC").

target.mrk: A registry key must start with "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE" ("HKLM") or "HKEY_USERS" ("HKU") or "HKEY_CURRENT_USER" ("HKCU") or "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT" ("HKCR") or "HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG" ("HKCC").

trans-unit.source: When running on 64-bit Windows if you want to read a value specific to the 64-bit environment you have to suffix the HK... with 64 i.e. HKLM64.

seg-source.mrk: When running on 64-bit Windows if you want to read a value specific to the 64-bit environment you have to suffix the HK... with 64 i.e.

target.mrk: When running on 64-bit Windows if you want to read a value specific to the 64-bit environment you have to suffix the HK... with 64 i.e.

trans-unit.source: AutoIt supports registry keys of type REG_BINARY, REG_SZ, REG_MULTI_SZ, REG_EXPAND_SZ, REG_QWORD, and REG_DWORD.

seg-source.mrk: AutoIt supports registry keys of type REG_BINARY, REG_SZ, REG_MULTI_SZ, REG_EXPAND_SZ, REG_QWORD, and REG_DWORD.

target.mrk: AutoIt supports registry keys of type REG_BINARY, REG_SZ, REG_MULTI_SZ, REG_EXPAND_SZ, REG_QWORD, and REG_DWORD.

trans-unit.source: To access the (Default) value use "" (an empty string) for the valuename.

seg-source.mrk: To access the (Default) value use "" (an empty string) for the valuename.

target.mrk: To access the (Default) value use "" (an empty string) for the valuename.

trans-unit.source: When reading a REG_BINARY key the result is a binary datatype (in previous versions it was a string of hex characters).

seg-source.mrk: When reading a REG_BINARY key the result is a binary datatype (in previous versions it was a string of hex characters).

target.mrk: When reading a REG_BINARY key the result is a binary datatype (in previous versions it was a string of hex characters).

trans-unit.source: When reading a REG_MULTI_SZ key the multiple entries are separated by @LF - use with StringSplit(..., @LF) to get each entry.

seg-source.mrk: When reading a REG_MULTI_SZ key the multiple entries are separated by @LF - use with StringSplit(..., @LF) to get each entry.

target.mrk: When reading a REG_MULTI_SZ key the multiple entries are separated by @LF - use with StringSplit(..., @LF) to get each entry.

trans-unit.source: It is possible to access remote registries by using a keyname in the form "\\computername\keyname". To use this feature you must have the correct access rights.

seg-source.mrk: It is possible to access remote registries by using a keyname in the form "\\computername\keyname".
To use this feature you must have the correct access rights.

target.mrk: It is possible to access remote registries by using a keyname in the form "\\computername\keyname".
To use this feature you must have the correct access rights.
